definitions: period when a country or region is not involved in armed conflict
examples: The economy flourished during peacetime after the treaty
Military spending decreased significantly in peacetime conditions

definitions: round juicy fruit with yellow flesh and fuzzy skin
soft pinkish-orange color resembling the fruit
examples: She picked fresh peaches from the orchard yesterday
The ripe peach dripped juice down her chin
The bedroom walls were painted a soft peach shade
She wore a lovely peach dress to the party

definitions: large male bird with brilliant blue and green plumage and fan-shaped tail
examples: The peacock displayed his magnificent tail feathers proudly
Several peacocks roamed freely around the palace gardens

definitions: large pheasant-like bird native to Asia including both male peacocks and female peahens
examples: The zoo kept several peafowl in their exotic bird exhibit
Wild peafowl are native to India and Sri Lanka

definitions: loud prolonged ringing of bells or similar resonant sound
examples: The church bells rang out in joyful peals
A peal of thunder echoed across the valley

definitions: sweet juicy fruit that tapers from a rounded base to narrower top
examples: She packed a ripe pear in her lunch box
The pear tree produced abundant fruit this season

definitions: hard lustrous sphere formed inside oysters and other mollusks
piece of valuable wisdom or advice
examples: The diver found a rare black pearl inside the oyster
She wore a string of cultured pearls around her neck
His grandfather shared pearls of wisdom about life
Each proverb contained a pearl of ancient knowledge

definitions: having the lustrous whitish color or sheen characteristic of pearls
examples: Her pearly white teeth gleamed when she smiled
The morning sky had a pearly gray luminescence

definitions: poor agricultural worker or small farmer especially in pre-industrial societies
examples: Medieval peasants worked the lord's fields for protection
The peasant family lived in a simple cottage

definitions: collective body of peasants or rural agricultural workers as a social class
examples: The peasantry revolted against harsh taxation policies
Most of the medieval peasantry lived in poverty

definitions: partially decomposed plant matter formed in wetlands used as fuel or soil additive
examples: Irish farmers traditionally burned peat for winter heating
The gardener added peat moss to improve soil texture

definitions: small rounded stone worn smooth by water or erosion
examples: Children skipped pebbles across the calm lake surface
The beach was covered with colorful pebbles

definitions: oval nut from a North American hickory tree with sweet rich flavor
examples: She added chopped pecans to the chocolate brownie batter
The famous pecan pie won first prize at the fair

definitions: quick sharp strike or bite made by a bird
unit of dry measure equal to eight quarts
examples: The chicken gave him a sharp peck on the hand
Birds pecked at seeds scattered on the ground
The farmer sold apples by the peck at market
She bought a peck of fresh green beans

definitions: natural substance in fruits that helps jams and jellies set when cooked with sugar
examples: Apples contain high levels of natural pectin for jam-making
She added powdered pectin to help the strawberry preserves gel

definitions: relating to the chest especially the major muscles of the upper chest
examples: He focused on pectoral exercises during his workout routine
The swimmer had well-developed pectoral muscles from training

definitions: unusual or distinctive characteristic that makes something different or strange
examples: The house had several architectural peculiarities worth noting
His peculiarity of speaking to plants amused his neighbors

definitions: teacher especially one who is overly formal pedantic or dogmatic in methods
examples: The old-fashioned pedagogue insisted on rote memorization techniques
Students found the stern pedagogue intimidating but effective

definitions: method and practice of teaching especially as an academic subject or theoretical concept
examples: Modern pedagogy emphasizes interactive learning over passive listening
She studied pedagogy to improve her classroom teaching techniques

definitions: lever operated by foot to control a machine vehicle or musical instrument
examples: She pressed the brake pedal to stop the car
The pianist used the sustain pedal for dramatic effect

definitions: person who travels around selling small goods often door-to-door
examples: The peddler carried household items in his cart
Street peddlers sold souvenirs to passing tourists

definitions: activity of traveling around to sell small items or illegal substances
examples: He made a living peddling watches on street corners
Police arrested suspects for peddling counterfeit merchandise

definitions: base or platform on which a statue or column stands
position of uncritical respect or admiration
examples: The marble statue stood on an ornate pedestal
The museum displayed artifacts on illuminated pedestals
She put her mentor on a pedestal for years
Athletes shouldn't be placed on pedestals as perfect role models

definitions: person walking along a road or in a developed area
examples: Pedestrians must use the crosswalk for safety reasons
The busy intersection was crowded with pedestrians

definitions: medical doctor who specializes in the care and treatment of infants children and adolescents
examples: The pediatrician examined the baby during the monthly checkup
Parents trusted their pediatrician for vaccination advice

definitions: recorded ancestry especially of purebred animals showing descent
distinguished or notable ancestry background or lineage
examples: The dog breeder provided a detailed pedigree certificate
The horse's pedigree traced back five generations
The professor had an impressive academic pedigree
Her pedigree included several famous artists and writers

definitions: triangular decorative element forming the gable of a roof in classical architecture
examples: The Greek temple featured an ornate pediment above columns
Carved figures adorned the pediment of the courthouse

definitions: adult who is sexually attracted to children in a harmful criminal manner
examples: The convicted pedophile was sentenced to prison
Parents warned children about potential pedophile dangers

definitions: psychiatric disorder involving adult sexual attraction to prepubescent children
examples: Psychologists study pedophilia to develop treatment programs
Laws strictly prohibit any acts related to pedophilia

definitions: informal word for urine or the act of urinating
examples: The toddler announced he needed to pee immediately
Dogs mark their territory with pee

definitions: quick or furtive look especially through a small opening
examples: She took a peek through the keyhole curiously
Children couldn't resist a peek at the wrapped presents

definitions: thin layer or strip of material especially skin removed from something
examples: Paint peelings flaked off the old wooden fence
She swept up the potato peelings from the kitchen floor

definitions: short high-pitched sound made by young birds or small animals
quick secretive look at something
examples: Baby chicks made soft peeps in their nest
Not a peep was heard from the sleeping children
He took a quick peep at his cards
She couldn't resist a peep at the surprise party preparations

definitions: system of titles of nobility and the body of peers collectively
examples: He was elevated to the peerage for public service
The British peerage includes dukes, earls, and barons

definitions: short cylindrical piece of wood or metal used for fastening or hanging
examples: She hung her coat on the wooden peg
Tent pegs secured the canvas to the ground

definitions: large water bird with a long bill and expandable throat pouch for catching fish
examples: Pelicans dove into the water to catch fish
The brown pelican is Louisiana's state bird

definitions: small rounded compressed mass of material such as food animal feed or ammunition
examples: The air rifle shot small metal pellets
Rabbit food comes in small pellet form

definitions: skin of an animal with fur or hair still attached
examples: Trappers sold beaver pelts to fur traders
The museum displayed various animal pelts

definitions: voluntary self-punishment or religious act to show repentance for sins
examples: The priest assigned penance after hearing confession
She performed acts of penance for her wrongdoings

definitions: strong habitual liking or tendency toward something
examples: She had a penchant for collecting vintage jewelry
His penchant for spicy food was well known

definitions: thin wooden shaft containing graphite core used for writing or drawing
examples: Students sharpened their pencils before the test
The artist sketched the portrait with a soft pencil

definitions: piece of jewelry that hangs from a chain worn around the neck
examples: She wore a diamond pendant on a gold chain
The antique pendant contained a small photograph

definitions: weight suspended from a fixed point that swings back and forth under gravity
examples: The grandfather clock's pendulum swung steadily
Scientists use pendulums to demonstrate physics principles

definitions: action or process of making way into or through something
extent to which a product or idea enters a market
examples: The knife's penetration was only surface deep
Water penetration damaged the building's foundation
The company achieved significant market penetration in Asia
Brand penetration increased after the advertising campaign

definitions: tool device or projectile designed to pierce or enter through barriers
examples: The military developed new armor penetrators
Concrete penetrators are used in construction work

definitions: black and white flightless seabird found mainly in Antarctic regions
examples: Emperor penguins huddled together for warmth
The penguin waddled awkwardly on land

definitions: antibiotic drug derived from mold used to treat bacterial infections
examples: The doctor prescribed penicillin for her strep throat
Alexander Fleming discovered penicillin by accident
